clinical_study.brief_title: Canadian Observation Trial in CF Patients Undergoing Treatment With Ivacaftor
clinical_study.official_title: Canadian Observation Trial in CF Patients Undergoing Treatment With Ivacaftor

brief_summary.textblock:
Specific aims:
1. To elucidate the biological mechanism that leads to pulmonary and nutritional improvement in CF patients following treatment with ivacaftor using advanced techniques to assess changes of the pulmonary and nutritional status
2. To examine the relation between the individual response to ivacaftor and the presence of modifier genes associated with CF disease severity,
3. To assess altered CFTR function using new available in vivo tests,
4. To validate newly developed in vivo sweat tests with well established functional tests,
5. To establish correlation between the CFTR response to Vx-770 measured in a new ex vivo method (organoids) and the actual clinical and/or functional response in individual patients,
6. To examine response in other CF-specific features such as aqua wrinkling.
7. To examine if sleep/activity level changes.
8. To establish a biorepository to enable further investigations.

primary_outcome.measure: Functional in vivo Cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductor regulator (CFTR) tests: Nasal Potential difference (NPD) measurements
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 study visits over a 2 year period
primary_outcome.description: NPD is measured to assess CFTR function as difference in mV between post and pre-drug start

primary_outcome.measure: Functional in vivo test: Beta-adrenergic sweat secretion test
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 study visits over a 2 year period
primary_outcome.description: The beta-adrenergic sweat secretion test is measured as ratio of beta-adrenergic/cholinergic sweat secretion as difference between post and pre-drug start

primary_outcome.measure: Functional in vitro test: Rectal tissue biopsies to measure CFTR function in vitro using Ussing chamber studies and organoids
primary_outcome.description: Rectal tissue specimen is being used to measure the response to ivcaftor of individual CF patients in vitro

primary_outcome.measure: Functional in vitro test: Collect nasal brushes for CFTR to generate nasal cell cultures for the assessment of ivacaftor response and CFTR function
primary_outcome.description: Nasal cultures are used to measure the response to ivcaftor in vitro as difference of the forskolin-induced response of CFTR to ivacaftor

secondary_outcome.description: CF patients response to submerge in water for 5 min to develop a skin phenomenon known as aqua wrinkling is being measured subjectively pre and post-drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurement of exhaled fractionated nitrogen oxide (FeNo)
secondary_outcome.description: the fraction of the exhaled NO in % In the expiration of CF patients is being measured pre-and post-drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurements of the lung clearance index
secondary_outcome.description: Multiple breath wash-out technique is being used to measure the lung clearance index (no unit) pre and post-drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurements of the pancreas function using fecal elastase test
secondary_outcome.description: Fecal elastase in stool is determined in microg/g stool pre and post-drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurements of the pancreas function using serum trypsinogen
secondary_outcome.description: Serum trypsinogen is determined in nmol/L pre and post-drug
Nutritional status is assessed using the BODPOD in kg fat or non-fat mass change or percentage fat or non-fat mass change pre and post-drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurements of the resting energy expenditure
secondary_outcome.description: The resting energy expenditure is measured using indirect calorimetry in kcal/d pre and post-post

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of pulmonary radiological changes using high resolution CT
secondary_outcome.description: Radiological pulmonary changes are being assessed using high resolution CT pre and post-drug (descriptive and Bhalla score)
Glucose tolerance is being assessed using the organ glucose tolerance test and glucose levels 2 hrs post in mmol/L will be compared pre and post-drug

study_pop.textblock: CF patients with any of the following mutations G551D, G178R, S549N, S549R, G551S, G1244E, S1251N, S1255P, G1349D and G970R approved by Health Canada to receive ivacaftor.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- any patient being prescribed ivacaftor
Exclusion Criteria:
- only relates to specific tests
